node.title: Coroner in tears at loss of 'beautiful boy' Bailey Mackander as she closes death-in-custody inquest
node.description: An emotional deputy State Coroner criticises the young detainee's guards, apologises to his parents and delivers recommendations she says she has no confidence will make any difference.
node.content:
["A\u00a0deputy state coroner has broken down as she closed\u00a0an inquest into the death in custody of a young Indigenous man she called \"a\u00a0beautiful boy in a not-so-beautiful system\".", "Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers\u00a0are advised that this article contains the name and images of a person who has\u00a0died.", "An emotional deputy State Coroner Elaine Truscott today criticised Bailey Mackander's guards and delivered a raft of recommendations but said she was not confident they would make any difference.", "\"Something has to change, but these findings will not stop courts sending young Baileys to prison or cause governments to invest more money in alternatives,\" she said.", "\"I suspect that will not even result in better mental help in prisons full of people who need it.\"", "Her voice quivered as told the Mackander family she was\u00a0\"so very, very sorry\", noting it was Bailey's birthday soon, which would be a very difficult time for his relatives.", "Wiradjuri man Bailey Mackander, 20, died on November 7, 2019, when he fell eight metres from a wall as he fled his minders after he was transferred from a cell to Gosford Hospital,\u00a0on the NSW central coast.", "He had been isolated in a \"safe\"\u00a0assessment cell at Kariong Correctional Centre, Gosford, where he was heard screaming in distress for two days, the inquest heard.", "A decision was made to take the Port Stephens man to Gosford Hospital.", "In the ambulance bay, as he was escorted back to a prison van, Mr Mackander broke free, scaled a wall and fell to his death.", "
Failings in care
", "Addressing the inquest, Ms Truscott wiped away tears while looking at a photo displayed in the courtroom.", "\"Poor Bailey, he was just a boy,\" she said.", "\"A beautiful boy in a not-so-beautiful system.\"", "She could not contain her emotions when describing his final moments.", "\"He was without psychological or social support or access to open air\u00a0or human interaction or telephone calls,\" she said.", "\u00a0\"It is was a tragic last few days of a young man who was really still a boy.", "", "
Bailey Mackander was the second youngest inmate at Kariong Correctional Centre at the time.(Supplied)
", "\"Bailey's teenage years of drug use did not lead to family turning away.", "\"Bailey is not some prisoner who no-one cared about, and desperate calls (by his mother) were dodged and unanswered.", "\"Bailey was not thinking and was driven by sudden impulsion.\"", "Ms Truscott said guards who implied he \"cried wolf\" did not help.", "\"Demeaning comments made about Bailey meant the treatment he\u00a0received fell short,\" she said.", "
Need for urgent change
", "Elaine Truscott made a raft of recommendations.\u00a0", "They included calls to review \"safe\" and \"assessment cell\"\u00a0placements and for corrective services to compile a list of First Nations elders who could be called to offer support to an inmate in distress.", "In addition, she said a psychologist should always be part of a Risk Intervention Team, like one that had overseen Bailey's care.", "She added that prison staff should have never have rejected or failed to return frantic calls by Bailey's mother.", "And in terms of the hospital transport, she said keeping hold of Bailey's handcuffs would be appropriate\u00a0and not an act of force", "", "
Mr Mackander's family is\u00a0furious and heartbroken.(Supplied: Facebook)
", "Bailey is the 459th First Nations inmate to die in custody since the black deaths in custody royal commission 30 years ago.", "That fact was not lost on his father, David Mackander, who said his son's passing needed to be a catalyst for change.", "\"I can't explain enough just how angry I am at the system,\" he said.", "Bailey's stepmother Melissa Mackander echoed those emotions.", "\"Bailey will become another name on a long list of Aboriginal deaths in custody,\"\u00a0she said.", "Bailey's mother, Tracy Mackander, said her life would never be the same.", "\"I have experienced darkness and my heart is broken in many pieces,\" she said.", "", "
A fence now surrounds the ambulance bay where Bailey Mackander fell.(Supplied: NSW Police)
"]
